headline.kicker: Connecticut Q&A: Dr. Mary Jane Minkin
headline.main: Making a Case for Estrogen Replacement

docs.abstract: Connecticut Q&A interview with New Haven gynecologist Mary Jane Minkin on menopause and estrogen replacement therapy; her photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: PICK up a newspaper, turn on the television, and someone is discussing menopause. But for all the information available about it, questions remain. How does one decide whether to treat menopause, and if so, how? What are the health needs of menopausal women? Dr. Mary Jane Minkin, an obstetrician and gynecologist in New Haven, offers her thoughts in ''What Every Woman Needs to Know About Menopause: The Years Before, During, and After'' (1996, Yale University Press).
